cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 300 mi SW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: expected to slow, then drift west-northwest and ultimately approach the central Texas coast early next week, staying well west of Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle–upper Texas coast (near Matagorda–Port O’Connor area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from east of High Island, TX to Morgan City, LA (does not include New Orleans)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Watch Port Aransas, TX to High Island, TX; Storm Surge Watch Port Mansfield, TX to High Island, TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-west Gulf Coast from the lower Rio Grande Valley through southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (<15%) of brief tropical-storm-force gusts early next week
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal rise (around 1–2 ft) possible west of the Mississippi Delta; no significant surge expected inside levee-protected port
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–3 inches of rain between Monday and Wednesday, with isolated higher totals in squalls
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and strong rip currents along the open Gulf beaches; minor navigation restrictions possible on lower Mississippi River due to swell
